name: Larva size
description: The area of a larva in pixel

name: Larva size variance
description: The area of a larva in pixel

name: Average grey value
description: The average grey value of all pixels of a larva

name: Grey value variance
description: The variance of the grey value of all pixels of a larva

name: Body length
description: The length of a larva along the spine

name: Body length variance
description: The length of a larva along the spine

name: Width
description: The width of a larva at its widest spot.

name: Width variance
description: The width of a larva at its widest spot.

name: Perimeter
description: The perimeter of a larva in pixel

name: Perimeter variance
description: The perimeter of a larva in pixel

name: Number of collisions
description: The number of collisions detected for a given larva.

name: Bending angle
description: The angle between the larva's tail vector, and a vector from the middle of the larva to its head. Positive values indicate the larva bending to the left, negative values bending to the right.

name: Bending angle variance
description: The angle between the larva's tail vector, and a vector from the middle of the larva to its head. Positive values indicate the larva bending to the left, negative values bending to the right.

name: Absolute bending angle
description: The angle between the larva's tail vector, and a vector from the middle of the larva to its head. The absolute bending angle indicates how much the larva is bent, independent from direction.

name: Absolute bending angle variance
description: The angle between the larva's tail vector, and a vector from the middle of the larva to its head. The absolute bending angle indicates how much the larva is bent, independent from direction.

name: CV Absolute bending angle
description: The angle between the larva's tail vector, and a vector from the middle of the larva to its head. The absolute bending angle indicates how much the larva is bent, independent from direction.

name: Bending angle bias
description: The angle between the larva's tail vector, and a vector from the middle of the larva to its head. The bias is set to be positive, and indicates whether the larva was bent more to any direction.

name: HV angular speed
description: The angular speed of the head vector (HV). Positive values indicate movement of the head to the right, negative values to the left.

name: HV angular speed variance
description: The angular speed of the head vector (HV). Positive values indicate movement of the head to the right, negative values to the left.

name: Absolute HV angular speed
description: The absolute angular speed of the head vector (HV).

name: Absolute HV angular speed variance
description: The absolute angular speed variance of the head vector (HV).

name: CV Absolute HV angular speed
description: The absolute angular speed variance of the head vector (HV).

name: HV angular speed bias
description: The angular speed of the head vector (HV). The bias is set to be positive, and indicates whether the larva made more movement to any direction.

name: HV angular acceleration
description: The angular acceleration of the head vector (HV). Positive values indicate movement of the head to the right, negative values to the left.

name: HV angular acceleration variance
description: The angular acceleration of the head vector (HV). Positive values indicate movement of the head to the right, negative values to the left.

name: Absolute HV angular acceleration
description: The absolute angular acceleration of the head vector (HV).

name: Absolute HV angular acceleration variance
description: The absolute angular acceleration of the head vector (HV).

name: CV Absolute HV angular acceleration
description: The absolute angular acceleration of the head vector (HV).

name: HV angular acceleration bias
description: The angular acceleration of the head vector (HV). The bias is set to be positive, and indicates whether the larva made more movement to any direction.

name: TV angular speed
description: The angular speed of the tail vector (TV). Positive values indicate movement to the right, negative values to the left.

name: TV angular speed variance
description: The angular speed of the tail vector (TV). Positive values indicate movement to the right, negative values to the left.

name: Absolute TV angular speed
description: The absolute angular speed of the tail vector (TV).

name: Absolute TV angular speed variance
description: The absolute angular speed variance of the tail vector (TV).

name: CV Absolute TV angular speed
description: The absolute angular speed variance of the tail vector (TV).

name: TV angular speed bias
description: The angular speed of the tail vector (TV). The bias is set to be positive, and indicates whether the larva made more movement to any direction.

name: TV angular acceleration
description: The angular acceleartion of the tail vector (TV). Positive values indicate movement to the right, negative values to the left.

name: TV angular acceleration variance
description: The angular acceleartion of the tail vector (TV). Positive values indicate movement to the right, negative values to the left.

name: Absolute TV angular acceleration
description: The absolute angular acceleration of the tail vector (TV).

name: Absolute TV angular acceleration variance
description: The absolute angular acceleration of the tail vector (TV).

name: CV Absolute TV angular acceleration
description: The absolute angular acceleration of the tail vector (TV).

name: TV angular acceleration bias
description: The angular acceleration of the tail vector (TV). The bias is set to be positive, and indicates whether the larva made more movement to any direction.

name: Head forward velocity
description: The velocity of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Head forward velocity variance
description: The velocity of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Head forward acceleration
description: The acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Head forward acceleration variance
description: The acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Absolute head forward acceleration
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Absolute head forward acceleration variance
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Head forward velocity (body length)
description: The velocity in body lengths of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral velocity component is ignored.

name: Head forward velocity (bl) variance
description: The velocity in body lengths of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral velocity component is ignored.

name: Head forward acceleration (bl)
description: The acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Head forward acceleration (bl) variance
description: The acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Absolute head forward acceleration (bl)
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Absolute head forward acceleration (bl) variance
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: CV Absolute head forward acceleration (bl)
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Tail forward velocity
description: The velocity of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Tail forward velocity variance
description: The velocity of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Tail forward acceleration
description: The acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Tail forward acceleration variance
description: The acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Absolute tail forward acceleration
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Absolute tail forward acceleration variance
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Tail forward velocity (body length)
description: The velocity in body lengths of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral velocity component is ignored.

name: Tail forward velocity (bl) variance
description: The velocity in body lengths of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral velocity component is ignored.

name: Tail forward acceleration (bl)
description: The acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Tail forward acceleration (bl) variance
description: The acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Absolute tail forward acceleration (bl)
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Absolute tail forward acceleration (bl) variance
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: CV Absolute tail forward acceleration (bl)
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored.

name: Midpoint speed
description: The speed of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Midpoint speed variance
description: The speed of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Midpoint acceleration
description: The acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Midpoint acceleration variance
description: The acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Abs midpoint acceleration
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Abs midpoint acceleration variance
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Midpoint speed (body length)
description: The speed of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction, measured in body lengths.

name: Midpoint speed (bl) variance
description: The speed of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction, measured in body lengths.

name: CV Midpoint speed (bl)
description: The speed of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction, measured in body lengths.

name: Midpoint acceleration (bl)
description: The acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Midpoint acceleration (bl) variance
description: The acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Abs midpoint acceleration (bl)
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Abs midpoint acceleration (bl) variance
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: CV Abs midpoint acceleration (bl)
description: The absolute acceleration of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction.

name: Distance traveled
description: The distance a larva has traveled while it was tracked.

name: Distance traveled (body length)
description: The distance a larva has traveled while it was tracked in larvae lengths.

name: Distance to SP (mean)
description: The average distance of an animal from its starting point.

name: Distance to SP (max)
description: The maximum distance of an animal from its starting point.

name: Transitions to odour side
description: The number of transitions to the primary side (defined as the side with the previously reinforced odour).

name: Transitions from odour side
description: The number of transitions from the primary side (defined as the side with the previously reinforced odour) to the other side of the dish.

name: Time before transition (to odour)
description: The average time an animal spent on the other side before it enters the primary side (defined as the side with the previously reinforced odour).

name: Time before transition (from odour)
description: The average time an animal spent on the primary side (defined as the side with the previously reinforced odour) before it enters the other side of the dish.

name: IS speed
description: The speed of the midpoint, measured only during runs.

name: IS speed variance
description: The speed of the midpoint, measured only during runs.

name: IS speed (body length)
description: The speed of a larva's midpoint, measured only during runs in body lengths.

name: IS speed (body length) variance
description: The speed of a larva's midpoint, measured only during runs in body lengths.

name: CV IS speed (body length)
description: The speed of a larva's midpoint, measured only during runs in body lengths.

name: IS angle
description: The inter-step (IS) angle indicates how much the orientation of the animal changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is defined as the angle between a larva's head vector at one step minus the head vector at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs. Positive values indicate that the larva changes its orientation to the left, negative values that it changes its orientation to the right.

name: IS angle variance
description: The inter-step (IS) angle indicates how much the orientation of the animal changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is defined as the angle between a larva's head vector at one step minus the head vector at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs. Positive values indicate that the larva changes its orientation to the left, negative values that it changes its orientation to the right.

name: Absolute IS angle
description: The inter-step (IS) angle indicates how much the orientation of the animal changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is defined as the angle between a larva's head vector at one step minus the head vector at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: Absolute IS angle variance
description: The inter-step (IS) angle indicates how much the orientation of the animal changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is defined as the angle between a larva's head vector at one step minus the head vector at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: CV Absolute IS angle
description: The inter-step (IS) angle indicates how much the orientation of the animal changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is defined as the angle between a larva's head vector at one step minus the head vector at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: IS angle bias
description: The inter-step (IS) angle indicates how much the orientation of the animal changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is defined as the angle between a larva's head vector at one step minus the head vector at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs. The bias is set to positive, indicating more movement into any direction.

name: IS distance
description: The inter-step (IS) distance measures the distance of the larva's midpoint between two steps. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: IS distance variance
description: The inter-step (IS) distance measures the distance of the larva's midpoint between two steps. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: IS distance (body length)
description: The inter-step (IS) distance measures the distance of the larva's midpoint between two steps in body lengths. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: IS distance (bl) variance
description: The inter-step (IS) distance measures the distance of the larva's midpoint between two steps in body lengths. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: CV IS distance (bl)
description: The inter-step (IS) distance measures the distance of the larva's midpoint between two steps in body lengths. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: IS interval
description: The inter-step (IS) interval measures the time between two steps. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: IS interval variance
description: The inter-step (IS) interval measures the time between two steps. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: CV IS interval
description: The inter-step (IS) interval measures the time between two steps. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs.

name: Number of Tail vel minima
description: The average number of minima points of tail forward velocity within each step

name: Ratio of 1-Minimum Steps
description: The ratio of steps with only one minimum in it.

name: Number of Head vel maxima
description: The average number of maxima points of head forward velocity within each interstep interval

name: Relative head vel peak
description: The maximal head forward velocity within each interstep interval relative to the peak in tail forward velocity at the step.

name: Relative interval of head vel peak
description: The interval between the maximal head forward velocity within an interstep interval and the step divided by the interstep interval.

name: Number of HCs
description: The number of head casts (HCs) a larva makes

name: Number of left HCs
description: The number of head casts (HCs) a larva makes towards the left.

name: Number of right HCs
description: The number of head casts (HCs) a larva makes towards the right.

name: HC angle
description: The HC angle is calculated as the bending angle after minus before a HC. Positive values indicate that the HC was to the left, negative values that it was to the right.

name: HC angle variance
description: The HC angle is calculated as the bending angle after minus before a HC. Positive values indicate that the HC was to the left, negative values that it was to the right.

name: Absolute HC angle
description: The HC angle is calculated as the bending angle after minus before a HC. The absolute HC angle is an estimate for the size of the HC, independent from direction.

name: Absolute HC angle variance
description: The HC angle is calculated as the bending angle after minus before a HC. The absolute HC angle is an estimate for the size of the HC, independent from direction.

name: CV Absolute HC angle
description: The HC angle is calculated as the bending angle after minus before a HC. The absolute HC angle is an estimate for the size of the HC, independent from direction.

name: HC angle bias
description: The HC angle is calculated as the bending angle after minus before a HC. The bias is set to positive values, indicating that the animal biased their HCs into any direction.

name: HC rate
description: The number of head casts (HCs) a larva makes per second.

name: HC rate (directed)
description: The number of head casts (HCs) a larva makes per second towards the left minus to the right.

name: HC rate bias
description: The number of head casts (HCs) a larva makes per second towards one direction minus the other one.

name: Bearing angle
description: The bearing angle is the angle between the tail vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that larvae are oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that they are oriented directly away from the odour. Positive values indicate the odour is to the right, negative values that the odour is to the left.

name: Bearing angle variance
description: The bearing angle is the angle between the tail vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that larvae are oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that they are oriented directly away from the odour. Positive values indicate the odour is to the right, negative values that the odour is to the left.

name: Absolute bearing angle
description: The bearing angle is the angle between the tail vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that larvae are oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that they are oriented deirectly away from the odour.

name: Absolute bearing angle variance
description: The bearing angle is the angle between the tail vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that larvae are oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that they are oriented deirectly away from the odour.

name: CV Absolute bearing angle
description: The bearing angle is the angle between the tail vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that larvae are oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that they are oriented deirectly away from the odour.

name: Bearing angle bias
description: The bearing angle is the angle between the tail vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that larvae are oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that they are oriented directly away from the odour. Positive values indicate the odour is to the right, negative values that the odour is to the left.

name: Heading angle
description: The heading angle is the angle between the head vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that the larva's head is oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that it are oriented directly away from the odour. Positive values indicate the odour is to the right, negative values that the odour is to the left.

name: Heading angle variance
description: The heading angle is the angle between the head vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that the larva's head is oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that it are oriented directly away from the odour. Positive values indicate the odour is to the right, negative values that the odour is to the left.

name: Absolute heading angle
description: The heading angle is the angle between the head vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that the larva's head is oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that it are oriented deirectly away from the odour.

name: Absolute heading angle variance
description: The heading angle is the angle between the head vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that the larva's head is oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that it are oriented deirectly away from the odour.

name: CV Absolute heading angle
description: The heading angle is the angle between the head vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that the larva's head is oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that it are oriented deirectly away from the odour.

name: Heading angle bias
description: The heading angle is the angle between the head vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0Â° indicates that the larva's head is oriented directly towards the odour, 180Â° that it are oriented directly away from the odour. Positive values indicate the odour is to the right, negative values that the odour is to the left.

name: Direction relative to Y
description: The angle between the tail vector and a vector in y-direction. 0° indicates that larvae are oriented directly upwards, 180° that they are oriented directly downwards. Positive values indicate the top of the Petri dish is to the right, negative values that it is to the left.

name: Direction relative to Y variance
description: The angle between the tail vector and a vector in y-direction. 0° indicates that larvae are oriented directly upwards, 180° that they are oriented directly downwards. Positive values indicate the top of the Petri dish is to the right, negative values that it is to the left.

name: Absolute direction relative to Y
description: The angle between the tail vector and a vector in y-direction. 0° indicates that larvae are oriented directly upwards, 180° that they are oriented directly downwards.

name: Absolute direction relative to Y variance
description: The angle between the tail vector and a vector in y-direction. 0° indicates that larvae are oriented directly upwards, 180° that they are oriented directly downwards.

name: CV Absolute direction relative to Y
description: The angle between the tail vector and a vector in y-direction. 0° indicates that larvae are oriented directly upwards, 180° that they are oriented directly downwards.

name: Direction relative to Y bias
description: The angle between the tail vector and a vector in y-direction. 0° indicates that larvae are oriented directly upwards, 180° that they are oriented directly downwards. Positive values indicate the top of the Petri dish is to the right, negative values that it is to the left.

name: HC reorientation
description: The absolute heading angle before a HC minus the absolute heading angle after the HC. Positive values indicate that the larva is oriented more towards the odour after the HC, negative values that the larva is oriented more away.

name: HC reorientation variance
description: The absolute heading angle before a HC minus the absolute heading angle after the HC. Positive values indicate that the larva is oriented more towards the odour after the HC, negative values that the larva is oriented more away.

name: Number of HCs towards
description: The number of head casts (HCs) a larva makes while being oriented towards the odour source, this means while having an absolute bearing angle < 90Â°

name: Number of HCs away
description: The number of head casts (HCs) a larva makes while being oriented away from the odour source, this means while having an absolute bearing angle > 90Â°

name: HC rate-modulation
description: The HC rate-modulation indicates whether the HC rate is modulated by the animal's orientation with respect to the odour, with positive values indicating that a larva has a lower HC rate while being oriented towards the odour (absolute bearing angle < 90Â°) than while being oriented away from the odour (bearing angle > 90Â°). It calculates as (HC rate away - HC rate towards)/(HC rate away + HC rate towards).

name: Run speed-modulation
description: The Run speed-modulation indicates whether the run speed is modulated by the animal's orientation with respect to the odour, with positive values indicating that a larva has a higher speed while being oriented towards the odour (absolute bearing angle < 90Â°) than while being oriented away from the odour (bearing angle > 90Â°). It calculates as (Run speed towards - Run speed away)/(Run speed towards + Run speed away).

name: IS reorientation
description: The inter-step (IS) reorientation indicates how much the orientation of the animal with respect to the odour changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is calculated as the larva's heading angle at one step minus the heading angle at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs. Positive values indicate that the larva changes its orientation towards the odour, negative values that it changes its orientation away from the odour.

name: IS reorientation variance
description: The inter-step (IS) reorientation indicates how much the orientation of the animal with respect to the odour changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is calculated as the larva's heading angle at one step minus the heading angle at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the tail forward velocity during runs. Positive values indicate that the larva changes its orientation towards the odour, negative values that it changes its orientation away from the odour.

name: Preference (time)
description: The preference is the time an animal spent on the half of the Petri dish that contained the odour minus the time spent on the other half, diveded by the total time.

name: Preference (distance)
description: The average distance of an animal from the odour source, transformed to a [-1;1] interval. A value of 1 indicates the animal is directly at the odour source, a value of -1 indicates it is at the maximal distance from the odour source, and a value of 0 indicates it is at the half-maximal distance from the odour source.

name: Time ratio towards odour source
description: The proportion of time a larva spent oriented towards the odour source, that is, with an absolute bearing angle < 90Â°.

name: Time ratio upwards
description: The proportion of time a larva spent oriented upwards the Petri dish (that is with an absolute direction relative to Y of < 45°) - the time a larva spent oriented downwards (that is with an absolute direction relative to Y of > 135°).

name: Velocity towards odour source
description: The velocity of the larva's midpoint in direction of the odour. Positive values indicate that the animal is moving toward the odour, negative values that the animal is moving away.

name: Changed distance to odour
description: The distance of an animal from the odour source at the end of the track minus the distance at the beginning of the track. Positive values indicate the larva ends closer to the odour than it started, negative values that it ends further away.

name: Distance to odour source
description: The average distance of an animal from the odour source.
